title: "Rename" contextual menu item in French is not capitalized
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.31.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.14.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode on a directory with existing files
2. Set interface language to French
3. In the file browser, right-click a file or directory.

Expected behaviour: the renaming option is called "Renommer"
Actual behaviour: the renaming option is called "renommer" (all other menu options are capitalized)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: VSCode API: InputBox.enabled doesn't work

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.31.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create basic extension with `yo code`
2. Add code which shows inputbox and set `enabled=false`: 
```typescript
let input = vscode.window.createInputBox();
input.enabled = false;
input.show();
```
3. VSCode allows input despite `enabled` setting for the input.

title: [shellscript] Indent rule/behavor seems broken
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Code 1.31.1 (1b8e8302e405050205e69b59abb3559592bb9e60, 2019-02-12T02:19:29.629Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.15.0 (ubuntu 16.04)

Steps to Reproduce:

Issue 1: if/while/for/case block has no indention rules

1. install new code 1.31.1 using deb package
2. open a shellscript file
3. type new "if" block like "if true; then" and hit return key
4. code doesn't indents (expected: automatically increase one indent)
5. same about while/for/case

Issue 2: auto-indent on move-line and/or paste not works

1. install new code 1.31.1 using deb package
2. open a shellscript file
3. move line across a indented block (such as function) never respects indents (see example below)
4. (same operation to a css/json file indents correctly)
5. (same operation to a c source has same issue)

example:

===
```bash
echo "moving this line into a function"

foo () {
    echo "this is a function block"
    return 0
}
```

===

```bash
foo () {
echo "moving this line into a function"
    echo "this is a function block"
    return 0
}
```

===

This is quite painful for me...

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Emojis are counted as two character in commit message line lengths
body:
Testing #68894

**Repo**
1. Stage a commit
1. In the commit message, enter 26 emoji

**Bug**
We incorrectly mark the subject line as being too long (over 50 characters) because each emoji is counted as 2+ characters

title: Disabled kerning in type-to-filter causes tree label to shift
body:
While testing #69299.

Notice the space between T and a:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/53370025-73ad5280-3901-11e9-80ea-2c70b7714fd7.png)

When not using type-to-filter:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/53370049-86278c00-3901-11e9-9462-67718a2ffd7f.png)

This causes the whole tree's labels to shift rightwards in variable amounts when typing, which isn't a pleasant experience.

title: Add tree match background theme color
body:
Testing #69299:

I quite like how this used to work:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/53362092-4014fd00-38ee-11e9-856a-527a9be21e00.png)

It's also consistent with IntelliSense:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/53363975-9e43df00-38f2-11e9-8ae1-8f68e086fcc6.png)

The new type to filter experience has some contrast problem, as the bg color of list item leaks into bg color of selection range because of transparency).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/53364492-c1bb5980-38f3-11e9-922a-91bb16fedd2c.png)

@joaomoreno I don't know if we are committed to this visual representation of filtering, but I'd suggest something like this (full height, offer 2 them-able colors for filtering, filterSelection fg/bg). This would make it much easier to maintain contrast.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/53364886-a9980a00-38f4-11e9-86db-d8e9f30bd281.png)

title: Consider something like Power Tools
body:
I recently discovered the [Power Tools Extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ego-digital.vscode-powertools) which adds functionality I have long been waiting for.

In short, it allows one to run custom scripts directly instead of heaving to create a dedicated extension. These scripts can interact with VSCode similar to extensions and even receive arguments. I haven't spend much time with this extension, yet I think this should be a core feature of VSCode.

While this shows that the extension API is powerful enough to support such a feature, I'd rather have this functionality coming directly from VSCode's authors, not depending on some third-party.

title: Parts of serverReadyAction should be contributed by chrome debug

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
Refs #69313

It feels like parts of the `serverReadyAction` are tightly coupled with the chrome debug extension.
Due to that I feel like those attributes should be contributed from the chrome debug extension - since they do not really make sense if the chrome debug extension is not installed.
An example of such an attribute is `webRoot`.
Another is the `"action": "debugWithChrome"`

If we allow these attributes to be contributed by the chrome extension it should make it easier to integrate this for other browser debug extensions like firefox.

title: Investigation: do not restart Extension host when first folder changes
body:
Today we restart the extension host whenever the first folder changes because `workspace.rootPath` is always set to that first folder and it never used to change after the extension host started once.

If we would not restart the extension host anymore an extension:
* could use `workspace.rootPath` as before, it would still point to the first folder always (which can be `undefined` if the workspace contains no folders)
* could subscribe to the `onDidChangeWorkspaceFolders` event to get notified about updates
* would see the value of `workspace.rootPath` changing during runtime whenever the first folder changes

//cc @sandy081 @jrieken

body:
Issue Type: Bug VSCode cannot analysis json schema location which includes chinese. It once made me very confused. See this: ``` "json.schemas": [ { //when starts with / and not includes Chinese,its ok. "url": "/Idea/Information/Schema/ElemInfo.json" }, { //when incudes Chinese,vscode cannot analysis this location. "fileMatch": ["/Idea/信息/Element/测试.json"], //cannot analysis,too. "url": "/Idea/信息/Schema/ElemInfo.json" }, { //though vscode can work well like this,its still a serious issue. "fileMatch": ["/Idea/*/Element/*.json"], //cannot analysis "url": "/Idea/信息/Schema/ElemInfo.json" } ] ``` By the way,I dont know how to make vscode work well with sub-schema. ``` //It will work well in jetbrains IDEA,but I dont know how to make it work well in vscode. "$ref":"/Idea/Information/Schema/ElemInfo.json#/definitions/Name" //Is there any Issue else? "$ref":"/Idea/Information/Schema/ElemInfo.json#/definitions/姓名" ``` By the way twice,it makes me very confused to define $schema property in common json files. ``` { //why it cannot be an relative location link? //show: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.1:80 //no matter whether u define this location in json.schema/0/url or not. //(in settings.json) "json.schemas": [{"url": "/Idea/Information/Schema/ElemInfo.json"} //BUT: its the right way in jetbrains IDEA. //"$schema":"/Idea/Information/Schema/ElemInfo.json", //show: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.1:80,too. //"$schema":"Idea\\Information\\Action\\SpecialSkill\\Schema\\ElemInfo.json", //still have some problems. //show: Problems loading reference 'file:///Idea/Information/_Global/Schema/PropList.json#/definitions/Comment': ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'd:\Idea\Information\_Global\Schema\PropList.json' //PropList.json is just another json schema file. //"$schema":"file:D:/My Documents/My Projects/Sample/Idea/Information/Action/Schema/ElemInfo.json", //its ok. title: Hide noisy breadcrumb entries like local variables
body:
Local variables in the breadcrumbs outline add too much noise. They make it hard to use breadcrumbs for overview or navigation.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/302938/53289733-e22bcc80-37aa-11e9-8339-0656509217c3.png)

It would be nice to have an option to exclude them from breadcrumbs.
Or maybe have nodes that only contain local variables collapsed by default.

title: increased GPU usage in 1.31.1
body:
in 1.31.1 my GPU (IGP in AMD A8-7600) stays at 655MHz all the time. 1.30.2 (the previous version i've used), opened in the same exact state, lets GPU sit at 351MHz.

this may definitely decrease battery life in case of laptops. in case of desktops, that's still a bug.

title: Suggest widget: right-click select broken
body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.31.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 18.10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Intellisense/Suggest widget so that at least two suggestions appear.
2. Right click an item that is not currently selected.

This used to select an item under the pointer without closing the widget and you could read the extended description. Now it inserts the suggestion under pointer (same as left click) and opens the context menu.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Workspace (.code-workspace) environment variable *definitions*
Avoid IConfigurationService.acquireInstantiationService()

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: [`IConfigurationService.acquireInstantiationService()`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/85618de/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.ts#L754) asks for trouble. We should not inject services to hide cyclic dependencies but rather break up these dependencies.

title: Open "Big" Interactive Parameter Hints Widgets in Collapsed State

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
I see a [related issue](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13480) involving font size, however I would like to suggest that the parameter widget (intellisense box) open in an interactive collapsed state.

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Problem: 

Currently the parameter hints widget is ginormous and pops up in an almost random fashion when working primarily with the keyboard (i.e. largely mouseless, vim-style editing). When it does start popping up, it is relentless and pops up for the exact same thing over and over while you're editing. The _worst_ problem is just how big it is. It obscures _fully a quarter of the editor screen_, on my laptop. 

Solution:

When the widget wants to display an enormous amount of information, the parameter hints widget should render itself smaller by opening it in an interactive, collapsed state consisting of a single line of (semi-opaque?) text or an ellipsis that the user could hover over to reveal.

Also, it might be nice to be able to simply toggle parameter hints on and off from the menu!

Using a multiplier with the count down syntax, ($@-), produces incorrect results. Per the example on [docs.emmet.io](https://docs.emmet.io/cheat-sheet/ ) under `Item numbering: $`: `ul>li.item$@-*5` should expand to: ```
``` Actual output: ```
```

title: Allow keybindings commands to override "top menu bar" shortcuts

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Hi,

We are developing an extension for VS Code. We have overridden `F5` and this works great using the command palette or pressing `F5`, but accessing it from the "top level menu bar" bypasses our custom command and directly calls our language server. It would be nice if the overriden command would execute instead.

This menu command skips our overriden implementation:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43748198/53169196-ddb1b900-35dc-11e9-85d1-42a4309fd0d2.png)

Thanks,

Johan

title: Use schemastore catalog to add schema associations for json files
body:
Fixed #26289 

The code source provided in this PR is a modified version of the source code of the [yaml-language-server](https://github.com/redhat-developer/yaml-language-server/blob/master/src/server.ts#L256-L302)

title: Scroll left-right only when long lines are visible
body: Issue Type: Feature Request if there is a long line anywhere in the file, the left-right scrolling is activated and affects me moving around in the file. If the long line is visible in the window, then yes, I want to be able to scroll left-right. Othewise only scroll up-down. It is annoying to edit a file with a long line because it keeps drifting to one side while I'm trying to scroll up-down. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.32.0-insider (aeaef41d51201e555735f5e8d2f38a9d0ddb9026, 2019-02-20T06:14:30.644Z) OS version: Darwin x64 18.2.0

title: Issue with lua strings when re-indenting
body: Issue Type: Bug In lua, with strings like "function", it indents all lines below it. Example: ```lua local isFunction = type(someVar)=="function" thisIsIndented() everyThingBelowToo() ``` This issue does not exist when writing in comments, only with strings like in the example above. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.32.0-insider (aeaef41d51201e555735f5e8d2f38a9d0ddb9026, 2019-02-20T06:17:32.389Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17763

title: Extension recommendations based on workspace remotes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Adds support for a `remoteBasedExtensionTips` property in the `product.json`, which contains key-value pairs of an extension id and a pattern to match the workspace remotes against.

I'm not sure who the feature owner of this area is now, so apologies if I've assigned the wrong person
